y, don't act surprised, but I think we got

tle pass.

 cushion

> Nightrazor simply watched the duo from his va=
ntage point. As they rose
> and searched he looked at them closely. He coul=
d tell that the ship had
> no clue as to his where abouts, but these two we=
re a different matter.

> It is only as they got closer he realized what=
 they were doing. The
> buffeting heat from the surface would be stalled or=
 redirected by his

 by indirect
> means. Then his attention was caught by the click of a magaz=
ine being
> loaded into position.

d and up, putting as much distance

m the surface below, even as the
> full clip of trackeing bullets were unle=
ashed by Chop.

to flood his

f moments
> Nightrazor's aerodynamic ebony form was revealed as he moved aw=
ay . . .

> For =
another moment ionized particles from his engines attracted the
> attention=
 of the bullets from Chop as Nightrazor pushed his engiens
> temporarilly b=
eyond what his cloaking shields could handle. But the
> bullets were quickl=
y left behind as the ship rose further into the air
> and the cloaking fiel=
d restablished its presence.

> Nightrazor considered firing back as he =
fled, but he knew as soon as he
> completely dropped his shields the other =
ship would no doubt open fire,
> and he was not here for conflict. With a b=
oost of power, now well
> within his cloaking field's ability to mask he ro=
se higher and higher
> into the air.

om a distance or move on, he was really

enders plus a well armed ship.
